meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Clinton Delays an Execution President Clinton has delayed the execution of a drug dealer from Texas who had been scheduled to be put to death this week in the first federal execution since 1963. PAGE A18
Ford Has a Small Stroke Hours after being saluted at the Republican convention, former President Gerald R. Ford was admitted to the hospital after suffering at least one small stroke. PAGE A16

Clinton Delays an Execution President Clinton has delayed the execution of a drug dealer from Texas who had been scheduled to be put to death this week in the first federal execution since 1963. PAGE A18
Ford Has a Small Stroke Hours after being saluted at the Republican convention, former President Gerald R. Ford was admitted to the hospital after suffering at least one small stroke. PAGE A16
Nudging Museums on Ethics Responding to the uproar over a rich collector's role in the ''Sensation'' exhibit, the American Association of Museums set down ethical guidelines. THE ARTS, PAGE E1
Rules for Medical Devices The Food and Drug Administration will impose new safety standards for medical devices that are intended to be used once but are instead cleaned and reused. PAGE A20
